messages.content: Vote for Matt on Thursday 6th of May between 7am and 10pm

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Campaigning to save the Camberley British Legion on Victoria Road, representing residents' views about the Mosque, campaigning for better traffic flows and parking at Frimley Park.
Labour will: Protect growth and resist cuts until the recovery is secured.
Labour will: Lock in catch up tuition for children who fell behind at schools.
Labour will: Guarantee cancer diagnosis within one week.

issues.economy: Labour will: Protect growth and resist cuts until the recovery is secured.
issues.education: Labour will: Lock in catch up tuition for children who fell behind at schools.
issues.health: Labour will: Guarantee cancer diagnosis within one week.

images.caption: Matt Willey - The Labour Party Candidate

leaflet.additionalNotes: Under the Tories: Immediate cuts would put recovery at risk. The Tories won't match our commitment to protect investment in frontline policing and schools. The Tories would cut Child Tax Credits and the Child Trust Fund for families on modest and middle incomes. The Tory priority is a tax cut for the 3000 richest people in Britain. The Lib Dems want an amnesty for illegal immigrants; The Lib Dems would cut Child Tax Credits and scrap the Child Trust Fund; Nick Clegg won't rule out a coalition with the Tories.
